title: Cunard launches Transatlantic Fashion Week voyage for 2016
text:
Cunard launches Transatlantic Fashion Week voyage for 2016 Cunard launches Transatlantic Fashion Week voyage for 2016 CUNARD has launched its first Transatlantic Fashion Week, a culinary tour of the British Isles and the largest Big Band Balls at sea in its new 2016 itineraries. PUBLISHED: 21:59, Thu, Oct 22, 2015 | UPDATED: 22:15, Thu, Oct 22, 2015 IG The cruise will celebrate the best of British fashion and food 
The inaugural Transatlantic Fashion Week voyage leaves Southampton to arrive in New York for New York Fashion Week 2016. 
The seven-night voyage, from September 1-8, will feature "an audience with" pioneering British designer Dame Sandra Rhodes CBE, the highly respected fashion historian Colin McDowell and Fern Mallis, who founded New York Fashion Week. 
Dame Sandra Rhodes, who has dressed some the world's best-known stars including Freddie Mercury and Jackie Onassis, said: "I'm extremely excited to be joining Canard on board Queen Mary 2 for the very first Transatlantic Fashion Week, 2016. 
"For me, it offers the opportunity to share my knowledge and wonderful experiences from throughout my career in fashion, and give guests a taste of what my collection has to offer." IG The cruise will celebrate the best of British fashion and food I'm extremely excited to be joining Canard on board Queen Mary 2 for the very first Transatlantic Fashion Week, 2016. Dame Sandra Rhodes 
Dame Chandra Rhodes will reveal designs from her collections while emerging faces from Storm modeling agency take to the catwalk during the voyage. 
Guests will also have the opportunity to meet the designers of the future, as students from the world's number one postgraduate fashion programme, The Royal College of Art, showcase their latest collections. 
Meanwhile, during the British Isles Culinary Discovery cruise on board Queen Elizabeth next June, food lovers can meet names from the world of gastronomy including Charles Sichel, of Maison Sichel, and wine critic Jilly Goolden. 
Regional delicacies from around the British Isles will be on offer through a range of tailored excursions, onboard events and specially curated menus. 
Each of the three Cunard Queens will host their very own Big Band Balls in November 2016 with music from the big band era of Glenn Miller, Count Basie and Duke Ellington. IG Dance and music lovers can look forward to being transformed to an era where elaborate Big Band Ball 
Angus Struthers, Cunard's Marketing Director, said: "Cunard has as its heart a celebrated history of guests dressing with style and a sense of occasion, as well as some of the finest dining at sea and of course the glamour of music and dance in the largest ball rooms at sea. 
"These very special cruises are sure to entice our most dedicated travelers and those new to cruising who are looking to immerse themselves in the very best of British fashion and food. 
"Dance and music lovers can look forward to being transformed to an era where elaborate Big Band Balls ruled the social circuits, as we celebrate 2016 in style."
